title: Local Development
description: Run Firebase services locally for testing

cards.description: Launches local emulators for all configured Firebase services (Functions, Firestore, Auth, etc.).
cards.whenToUse: When developing locally and need to test Firebase features without affecting production.
scenarios: Local development: Testing your app against local Firebase services
Offline work: Developing without internet connectivity
Safe testing: Avoiding charges and production data changes

cards.description: Starts only the specified emulators, useful when you don't need all services.
cards.whenToUse: When you only need certain Firebase services for your current task.
scenarios: Backend focus: Running only Functions emulator for API development
Database work: Running only Firestore for data modeling
Resource saving: Starting fewer emulators for better performance

cards.task: Start emulators and import existing data
cards.description: Starts emulators with pre-existing data loaded from a directory.
cards.whenToUse: When you want to start with specific test data or restore a previous state.
scenarios: Test data: Loading seed data for consistent testing
State restoration: Continuing where you left off in development
Demo setup: Preparing emulators with demo data for presentations

cards.task: Start emulators and export data on shutdown
cards.description: Automatically saves emulator data when you stop the emulators.
cards.whenToUse: When you want to preserve your local development data between sessions.
scenarios: Data persistence: Saving Firestore data between coding sessions
Iterative testing: Preserving test user accounts in Auth emulator
Long projects: Maintaining state across multiple development days

cards.task: Start a local development server for hosting
cards.description: Starts a local server for Firebase Hosting content only (simpler than full emulators).
cards.whenToUse: When you only need to preview hosting content without other Firebase services.
scenarios: Static site preview: Testing HTML/CSS/JS changes locally
Quick preview: Faster startup than full emulator suite
Frontend only: When backend services aren't needed

cards.task: Export current emulator data to a directory
cards.description: Saves the current state of all running emulators to a directory.
cards.whenToUse: When you want to save your current emulator state for later use.
scenarios: Backup creation: Saving test data before making major changes
Sharing state: Exporting data to share with teammates
Snapshot: Creating a checkpoint of your local development data

cards.task: Run a script against the emulators
cards.description: Starts emulators, runs a command, then shuts down emulators when done.
cards.whenToUse: When running automated tests that need Firebase emulators.
scenarios: CI/CD testing: Running integration tests in pipelines
Automated testing: Executing test suites against emulators
Script execution: Running one-off scripts with emulator access
